titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: J.J. Henry Co., were a New York naval architecture firm. The firm designed the naval icebreaker Glacier, and helped develop a fleet of ships to take liquefied gas from Algeria to London and from the Persian Gulf to Tokyo.

scopecontent.p: Collection of papers of J.J. Henry Co. Materials include black and white photographs of ships designed by J.J. Henry Co. Images show construction, launches, and trial trips. Ships include: Potomac (rebuilt and renamed Shenandoah), Baune, David P. Reynolds, and Rio San Juan. The collection also includes a small number of photographs and negatives of company executives and employees. Other items in the collection include: a brief history of the company; biographical sketches of officers and employees of the company, 1967; applications packets for listing on the Bureau of Ship Bidders list of firms qualified to render design services, 1954; notes and drafts for J.J. Henry Co. newsletters; a brochure for the Joseph H. Thompson, miscellaneous newsletters and shipbuilding publications; two copies of a heat balance and flow diagram by the company; and two reels of 16mm film (no sound) of seakeeping tests of a mariner vessel and conversion, 1970.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
